blocks.text: The Xiegu G106 is a basic 5W portable QRP transceiver with an SDR infrastructure using 16-bit CODEC sampling. It supports three transmission modes (SSB, CW, AM) plus FM broadcast reception (88-108 MHz). As an entry-level robust SDR transceiver, the G106 is well suited to QRP CW and FT-8 operations.

Long-press the power button to turn on or off. Short-press after power on to toggle the display backlight. The T/R indicator shows transmit/receive status. Turn the volume knob to adjust volume; short-press to switch between internal speaker and speaker-microphone output.

Short-press MODE to switch between operating modes. Long-press MODE to toggle the preamplifier. The < and > buttons switch bands (short press) or change tuning step position (long press 2 sec). Press both < and > together to lock/unlock all controls.
With the external DE-19 digital adapter unit, the G106 can connect to a computer for digital modes like FT-8. Local FM broadcasts can be listened to while operating portable.

The G106 uses a five-page multi-function menu system. Short-press any multi-function button to call up the menu, then turn the main tuning knob to switch between pages. Press the button corresponding to the displayed function. Some functions require pressing SAVE; pressing QUIT exits without saving.

blocks.name: V/M
blocks.description: Switch between frequency (VFO) mode and channel memory mode.

blocks.name: MW (Memory Write)
blocks.description: Store current frequency and settings to a memory channel.

blocks.name: CSN (Call Sign)
blocks.description: Set your call sign for the startup display.

blocks.name: BSM (Band Switch Mode)
blocks.description: Choose Ham bands only or Full (ham + shortwave broadcast) for band switching rotation.

blocks.text: The KEY socket is a 3.5mm stereo jack for straight keys or paddles. For straight keys with 6.5mm 2-pole plugs, rewire to 3.5mm stereo with the key wire going to either 'Di' or 'Da' terminal.

blocks.name: CWF (CW Filter)
blocks.description: Select digital CW filter bandwidth. Three bandwidths available to help receive weak CW signals.

blocks.name: CWT (CW Tone)
blocks.description: Adjust the CW sidetone frequency to your preference.

blocks.text: Direct use of some 2-pole to 3-pole adapters or incorrect wiring may result in the radio sticking in CW transmit mode.
The G106 includes a digital CW filter with three bandwidth settings to help copy weak CW signals. Access via the CWF menu option.
Long-press MODE to toggle the receive preamplifier on/off for improved sensitivity on weak signals.
The G106 operates from 9-16V external DC power through a 5.5/2.5mm DC socket. The power supply must provide at least 3A current capacity. Use the supplied power lead with pre-fitted EMC ferrite bead.
The white center-core wire connects to positive, metal shield to negative. A user-added fuse in the power lead is recommended.
Carefully check polarity before connection. The limited warranty does not cover damage from external power connection faults or out-of-range voltage.
The G106 does not have a built-in automatic antenna tuner. For antenna matching, use an external ATU or resonant antennas.
The 50Ω BNC antenna socket connects directly to your antenna system. Ensure good SWR before transmitting at full power.

blocks.name: Controls locked
blocks.description: Press both < and > buttons simultaneously to unlock all panel controls.

blocks.name: No backlight
blocks.description: Short-press the power button after power on to toggle backlight.

blocks.name: Factory reset
blocks.description: Use the factory reset function in the menu to restore default settings.

blocks.name: FM stations not in rotation
blocks.description: In FM mode, the < and > buttons switch between stored FM stations rather than bands.

blocks.name: Keypad beep
blocks.description: Enable or disable the keypad confirmation tone through the menu system.
